forms.me (myself): Je me lève à 7h. → I get up at 7.
forms.te (yourself): Tu te brosses les dents. → You brush your teeth.
forms.se (himself/herself/itself): Il se lave. → He washes himself.
forms.nous (ourselves): Nous nous amusons. → We’re having fun.
forms.vous (yourself/yourselves): Vous vous habillez vite. → You dress quickly.
forms.se (themselves): Elles se parlent souvent. → They talk to each other often.

example.fr: Used with reflexive verbs when the subject does something to themselves. ref65lexive pronouns + verb.

forms.me (me): Il me voit. → He sees me.
forms.te (you): Je te connais. → I know you.
forms.le (him/it): Elle le mange. → She eats it.
forms.la (her/it): Je la vois. → I see her.
forms.nous (us): Ils nous aiment. → They love us.
forms.vous (you): Je vous entends. → I hear you.
forms.les (them): Il les lit. → He reads them.

example.fr: Replace the direct object (what or who receives the action directly).

forms.me (to me): Il me parle. → He talks to me.
forms.te (to you): Je te téléphone. → I call you.
forms.lui (to him/her): Elle lui écrit. → She writes to him/her.
forms.nous (to us): Ils nous donnent un cadeau. → They give us a gift.
forms.vous (to you): Je vous réponds. → I reply to you.
forms.leur (to them): Il leur parle. → He talks to them.

example.fr:
Used when the verb is followed by à + person
In French, lui is an indirect object pronoun, and indirect object pronouns come before the verb
example.en: Elle écrit une lettre à Marc. → Elle lui écrit.

forms.toi (you): Pour toi, je ferais tout. → For you, I’d do anything.
forms.lui (him): Je pense à lui. → I’m thinking about him.
forms.elle (her): Avec elle, c’est toujours amusant. → With her, it’s always fun.
forms.nous (us): Entre nous, c’est fini. → Between us, it’s over.
forms.vous (you): Sans vous, je suis perdu. → Without you, I’m lost.
forms.eux (them (masc)): Je parle d’eux. → I’m talking about them.
forms.elles (them (fem)): J’ai vu elles aussi. → I saw them too.
forms.soi (oneself): Chacun pense à soi. → Everyone thinks of themselves.

example.fr: Used for emphasis, after prepositions, or alone.

forms.le mien / la mienne (mine): Ce livre est le mien. → That book is mine.
forms.les miens / les miennes (mine (pl.)): Ce sont les miens. → They are mine.
forms.le tien / la tienne les tiens / les tien: La voiture ? C’est la tienne. → The car? It’s yours.
forms.le sien / la sienne /les siens / les sie: Ce stylo est le sien. → That pen is his.
forms.le nôtre / la nôtre / les nôtres (ours): Cette idée est la nôtre. → This idea is ours.

example.fr: Replace a noun and show ownership.

forms.celui (the one (masc)): Celui que je préfère est bleu. → The one I prefer is blue.
forms.celle (the one (fem)): Celle-ci est jolie. → This one is pretty.
forms.ceux (the ones (masc)): J’aime ceux du fond. → I like the ones in the back.
forms.celles (the ones (fem)): Celles que tu vois sont nouvelles. → The ones you see are new.
forms.ceci / cela / ça (this / that): Ceci est important. → This is important., Ça va ? → How’s it going?, Cela ne me plaît pas. → I don’t like that.
